result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquez Carvon Vines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 7 years bifurcated sentence.    Corrected 03/24/16 to include credit for time served.
Consecutive to: to time now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time employment, attend school full time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full time hours.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Obey all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Provide DNA sample if not previously provided.  Pay DNA surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  No contact, directly or indirectlly, with any co-actors, members of the "money team" or Chicago "Folk Nation".  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to time now serving
